bibl.note: 1881 Oct. 31 J.G.M. Ramsey, Knoxville, Tenn. Memo concerning his agreement with Mr. Fagan concerning the tombstones for his grandparents' graves.

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

keywords.term: Ramsey, J. G. M. (James Gettys McGready), 1797-1884 -- Correspondence.

revisionDesc.change: Migrating from XML to validated TEI P5.

div.p: Store butler for one bread store. this contract made in the last summer or fall

I contracted with Mr. Phagan the store butler to make for my Grand-parents a bread store to be over their grocers in Lebanon Church yard & me to do the engraving as written by me & handed to him for which I am to pay him twenty five dollars ($25.00) on Christmas Dec. 25. 1881. J.G.M. Ramsey
